overview:
“Most recently David was VP of Online Marketing for Imagitas (now a Pitney Bowes Company), a marketing solutions firm which provides privacy-protected access to hard-to-reach consumer audiences through public/private partnerships with state and Federal agencies, including the US Postal Service. Before joining Imagitas, David was Director of Marketing at Sharebuilder.com. Prior to this, David played an instrumental role at Microsoft where his business development work was featured in Fortune magazine. Over seven years at Microsoft, David held various positions in product management, marketing and business development in MSN and Microsoft Office product groups. David also spent five years with Procter & Gamble in Europe and Latin America where he left as a Brand Manager. He also took a year out before college to be an Assistant Teacher in the public school system of his native Trinidad and Tobago.

David earned a B.A. in Computing and Economics (Hons, First Class) from Eliot College, the University of Kent at Canterbury, and the MPhil in Management Studies from the University of Oxford. In 1990 David was elected a Rhodes Scholar.” (Source: SimpleTuition)
